page.title: 02LANDSCAPE
page.content: It is a coastal area to the South-East of St. Andrews. The land is undulating boulder clay, sloping gradually to the coast with a North-East aspect. The highest point is Easter Balrymonth Hill (109 metres) in the South of the block. Local rock outcrops are of sandstone which in the past have been quarried. Soils generally are sandy but fertile. There is almost a continuous rocky shore with cliffs of 25 metres at Kinkell Braes but they gradually become lower towards the South-East. Sublittorarly, the sea at St Andrews is relatively shallow. At Bell Rock Lighthouse, it is 20 fathoms which is some 15 miles offshore. The bottom is mud and sand.
